Class EfsDispatcher.Builder

java.lang.Object
org.efs.dispatcher.EfsDispatcher.Builder
Enclosing class:
EfsDispatcher
public static final class EfsDispatcher.Builder extends Object
Builder for constructing EfsDispatcher instance.
EfsDispatcher Properties
Name Type Required? Default Value Description
dispatcher name String Yes NA Unique dispatcher name within JVM. May not be null or an empty string.
dispatcher type DispatcherType Yes NA Specifies whether this is an efs dispatcher or a special dispatcher (such as Swing or JavaFX GUI thread).
thread type ThreadType No DEFAULT_THREAD_TYPE Specifies whether this thread is blocking, spinning, spin+park, or spin+yield.
dispatcher thread count int Yes NA Dispatcher's subordinate thread count. Ignored if dispatcher type is special.
thread priority int No DEFAULT_PRIORITY Each dispatcher subordinate thread is set to this priority. Values must be Thread.MIN_PRIORITY ≤ priority ≤ Thread.MAX_PRIORITY.
spin limit long No DEFAULT_SPIN_LIMIT Each dispatcher thread spins this many times attempting to acquire next runnable agent before parking or yield. Property only used if thread type is spin+park or spin+yield.
park time Duration No DEFAULT_PARK_TIME Each dispatcher thread parks this amount of time before spinning on agent queue again. Property only used if thread type is spin+park.
affinity ThreadAffinityConfig No null Thread affinity for dispatcher subordinate threads. Ignored if dispatcher type is special.
event queue capacity int No EfsDispatcher.DEFAULT_EVENT_QUEUE_CAPACITY Agent maximum event queue size assigned to agents registered with this dispatcher.
agent queue capacity int Yes Na Maximum number of runnable agents which may be posted to dispatcher run queue.
maximum events per agent callout int Yes NA An agent may process up to this many events in a single run. This is to prevent one agent from dominating its dispatcher, prevents other agents from processing events.
dispatcher lambda Consumer<Runnable> Yes if dispatcher type is special NA Method used to post a Runnable task to special dispatcher thread.

Example Building EfsDispatcher

import org.efs.dispatcher.EfsDispatcher;
import org.efs.dispatcher.EfsDispatcher.DispatcherType;
import org.efs.dispatcher.config.ThreadType;

    // EfsDispatcher.Builder automatically stores dispatcher
    // instance in dispatcher map using its unique name as key
    // and starts dispatcher.
    // Therefore there is no reason to place built EfsDispatcher
    // in a local variable since that dispatcher instance can be
    // readily accessed by its name via
    // EfsDispatcher.getDispatcher(name).
    (EfsDispatcher.builder()).dispatcherName("FastAlgoDispatcher")
                             .dispatcherType(DispatcherType.EFS)
                             .threadType(ThreadType.SPINNING)
                             .numThreads(1)
                             .priority(Thread.MAX_PRIORITY)
                             // See ThreadAffinityConfig.
                             .threadAffinity(sFastAlgoAffinity)
                             .eventQueueCapacity(128)
                             .runQueueCapacity(64)
                             .maxEvents(16)
                             .build();
    (EfsDispatcher.builder()).dispatcherName("SlowAlgoDispatcher")
                             .dispatcherType(DispatcherType.EFS)
                             .threadType(ThreadType.SPINPARK)
                             .numThreads(1)
                             .priority(Thread.MAX_PRIORITY - 1)
                             // Spin 1,000,000 times then park for 1 microsecond.
                             .spinLimit(1_000_000L)
                             .parkTime(Duration.ofNanos(1_000L)
                             // See ThreadAffinityConfig.
                             .threadAffinity(sSlotAlgoffinity)
                             .eventQueueCapacity(128)
                             .runQueueCapacity(64)
                             .maxEvents(16)
                             .build();
    (EfsDispatcher.builder()).dispatcherName("DefaultDispatcher")
                             .dispatcherType(DispatcherType.EFS)
                             .threadType(ThreadType.BLOCKING)
                             .numThreads(8)
                             .priority(Thread.MIN_PRIORITY)
                             .eventQueueCapacity(128)
                             .runQueueCapacity(128)
                             .maxEvents(8)
                             .build();

Note: build() does not return an EfsDispatcher instance. User accesses this instance using the configured dispatcher name. This violates Builder pattern but is done to limit access to dispatcher instances.

Author:
Charles W. Rapp

    • dispatcherType

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder dispatcherType(EfsDispatcher.DispatcherType type)
      Sets dispatcher type.
      Parameters:
      type - dispatcher type.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.

    • threadType

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder threadType(ThreadType type)
      Sets dispatcher thread type.
      Parameters:
      type - thread type.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.

    • numThreads

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder numThreads(int numThreads)
      Sets dispatcher thread count.
      Parameters:
      numThreads - number of threads in dispatcher.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if numThreads is ≤ zero.

    • priority

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder priority(int priority)
      Sets the thread priority. Must be ≥ Thread.MIN_PRIORITY and ≤ Thread.MAX_PRIORITY. If not set, then defaults to Thread.NORM_PRIORITY.
      Parameters:
      priority - assigned thread priority for scheduled executor thread.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if priority < Threads.MIN_PRIORITY or > Thread.MAX_PRIORITY.

    • spinLimit

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder spinLimit(long limit)
      Sets ThreadType.SPINPARK or ThreadType.SPINYIELD spin limit. This setting is ignored for any other dispatcher thread type.
      Parameters:
      limit - spin limit.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if limit ≤ zero.

    • parkTime

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder parkTime(Duration time)
      Sets spin+park park time limit. This setting is ignored for any other dispatcher thread type.
      Parameters:
      time - park time limit.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if time is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if time is ≤ zero.

    • threadAffinity

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder threadAffinity(@Nullable ThreadAffinityConfig affinity)
      Sets optional thread affinity to the given configuration list. Thread affinity should be considered when using spinning thread types.
      Parameters:
      affinity - thread affinity configuration.
      Returns:
      this thread builder.

    • eventQueueCapacity

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder eventQueueCapacity(int capacity)
      Sets efs agent event queue capacity. This capacity is applied to each efs agent associated with this dispatcher.

      capacity should be a 2 power value. If not, event queue capacity is set to the next 2 power value > given capacity.

      Parameters:
      capacity - event queue maximum capacity.
      Returns:
      this Builder instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if capacity is < EfsDispatcher.MIN_EVENT_QUEUE_SIZE.

    • runQueueCapacity

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder runQueueCapacity(int capacity)
      Sets efs dispatcher agent queue capacity.

      The capacity should be a 2 power value. If not, agent queue capacity is set to the next 2 power value > given capacity.

      Parameters:
      capacity - run queue maximum capacity.
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if capacity is ≤ zero.

    • maxEvents

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder maxEvents(int maxEvents)
      Sets maximum number of events agent is allowed to process per call out.
      Parameters:
      maxEvents - maximum events per call out..
      Returns:
      this dispatcher builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if maxEvents is ≤ zero.

    • dispatcher

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder dispatcher(Consumer<Runnable> dispatcher)
      Sets dispatcher method used to post efs agent to dispatcher run queue for a special dispatcher only. This value is ignored for efs dispatcher.
      Parameters:
      dispatcher - dispatcher method.
      Returns:
      this Builder instance.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if dispatcher is null.

    • set

      public EfsDispatcher.Builder set(EfsDispatcherConfig config) throws ClassNotFoundException
      Configures efs dispatcher as per given configuration. Note that this configuration only supports efs dispatcher type.
      Parameters:
      config - efs dispatcher configuration.
      Returns:
      this Builder instance.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if config.getClasses() contains a class name which cannot be converted into a Java class instance.

    • build

      public void build()
      Creates a new EfsDispatcher instance based on this builder's settings and stores in dispatcher map.

      Note: this method does not return an EfsDispatcher instance. User accesses this instance using the configured dispatcher name. This violates Builder pattern but is done to limit access to dispatcher instances.

      Throws:
      net.sf.eBus.util.ValidationException - if this Builder instance contains one or more invalid settings.
      ThreadStartException - if an underlying dispatcher thread fails to start.
